intro: Medinilla tetraptera, commonly known as the velvet tangerine, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its native habitat. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and have a citrus-like flavor. Medinilla tetraptera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and resilience.
